text: hello and welcome to a new video on
Amazon comprehend or as we call it
Cambrian video snacks
Amazon comprehend is a fully managed and
continuously trained AI service from
Amazon web services that can derive and
understand valuable insights from text
within documents today we will talk
about our newest feature launch for
custom comprehend
my name is Godwin Vincent and I am an
Enterprise solution architect with
Amazon web services team and I'll be
joined today by Sebastian Lex a senior
solution architect with Amazon web
services
in the part one of the series custom
document classification using Amazon
comprehend you have seen the intelligent
document processing challenges across
Industries and how we have built an IDP
architecture to solve classification
tasks for the insurance documents like
claim form policy document contracts
Insurance ID Etc in the second part we
will dive deep and explore how you can
perform custom entity recognition using
Amazon comprehend and its latest
features
custom entity recognition extends the
capability of Amazon comprehend by
helping you to identify entity types
specific to your business domain
custom entity detection is a two-step
process first you train a custom entity
recognizer model to recognize the
entities that are of importance to you
secondly you use your model to detect
the entities within any documents
let us dive deep further how you can use
custom entity recognizer to detect the
custom entities within the insurance
documents
a typical document processing workflow
involves documents in multiple formats
like semi-structured PDF PNG jpg Etc
documents can be of multiple Pages or
single page and it can be digital or
scanned
until now in order to detect entities
from semi-structured documents like PDF
or image you have to first extract the
plain text out of the documents and then
use the plain text to detect the
entities using a trained Amazon
comprehend entity recognizer this
process is complex and needs processing
which often complicates the document
processing workflow
let me now request Sebastian Lex to walk
us through how the new feature in
comprehend can simplify the workflow
as you can see the steps outline in the
diagram you had to leverage other
services like Amazon text track to
pre-process the document and then use
plain text for Amazon comprehend name
entity recognizer to detect custom
entities
in short you had to linearize or convert
native documents into utf-8 format to
perform inference this was complex
tedious and time consuming for customers
and based on customer feedback we are
excited to announce the support for
documents in Native formats for both the
real-time and asynchronous entity
detection using Amazon comprehend
let's look at an updated architecture
view of how we can use the Amazon
comprehend custom entity recognition
using the new feature
you can now simply call NDT detection
apis and pass any document in Native
format like PDF or jpeg GIF or Tiff
images
all the heavy lifting of linearizing or
converting native documents to text
format is no longer required with this
feature you can perform entity detection
in both real-time and asynchronous mode
let's look at our insurance industry
document flow example
in this architecture the flow is
triggered by a PDF document placed in
the Amazon S3 bucket which triggers an
event to execute the AWS Lambda function
that prepares the data for processing
the AWS their functions workflow tracks
each state of the execution allowing the
stages to execute and compete
synchronously or asynchronously as
needed
in our architecture the workflow starts
with AWS Lambda invocation of custom
name entity recognition task
you can see that you can directly use as
an input the insurance document in its
native PDF format Amazon comprehend the
text name entities and generates output
that contains both the entities and the
document structure metadata and stores
the results in S3 from here you can
either trigger subsequent workflows or
feed the extracted entities to
Downstream systems
as you can see with this architecture
you can quickly and efficiently extract
name entities from documents in their
native format like PDF or new images
without involving additional activities
next we'll walk through this
functionality in the Amazon comprehend
console
go to AWS Management console
type comd again in the search bar
and click on Amazon comprehend
once on the Amazon comprehend console
click on custom entity recognition on
the left panel
and then click on create new model
enter the model name
enter the model version name
select English as the language
and add the entity types you want the
recognition to identify in your data set
now you have added all the entity types
required for training
and in the data specification section
select augmented manifest type
and then choose PDF Word documents as a
training model type
we have already prepared three input
files required for this training in
advance and stored in S3 location
enter the S3 location of augmented
manifest file
enter the location of annotation data
file
enter the S3 location of source
documents
finally enter the attribute name which
is ground truth labeling job ID we used
for annotations then click add
select IIM user role which will provide
Amazon comprehend permission to access
Amazon S3 packets I am choosing the role
Creator already with S3 full access
we will leave the remaining option as
default and click create
to start the trading jar depending on
the size of your training data set your
time to train the model will vary in our
case the model will take about 30
minutes to train you can see the
training status of the model here
now that we have a custom recognizer
model trained and we will deploy this
model behind the real-time endpoint
you can use real-time endpoints for use
cases which need low latency entity
detection functionality
for bulk document entity detection
asynchronous analysis jobs with the
trained model can be used
click on endpoints on the left panel
and then click on create endpoint
now enter the employee name
then choose the custom entity
recognition then choose the model we
trained then choose the version
then enter the inference unit as 1.
then click create endpoint to create the
endpoint for your model
now that we have a model trained and a
real-time endpoint created we can start
using it to detect entities for sample
document
to do that let's navigate to the
real-time analysis page on the left
panel and select analysis type as custom
and choose the custom model type as
custom entity recognition
and select the endpoint we deployed
and choose the upload file and click the
button choose file and you can choose
any semi structure document such as PDF
or image file
here I am choosing PDF file
for inference
click on Advanced document input
and choose document read mode as service
default
and choose document read action as
extract detect document text
now click analyze button
we can see here that the entities and
the types detected from the document you
can also see the confidence score of
each entities detected
if you scroll down a bit you will see
the Json APA response under the
application integration section you can
use this information for further
processing now we are going to see how
our trained entity recognizer model will
be used for byte document entity
detection using asynchronous analysis
jar
click analysis job menu on the left menu
bar
and click on create job
enter the job name
and choose the analysis type as custom
entity recognition
and choose the recognizer model
you trained
and choose the version of your model
and choose input data essay location
which contains all the documents that
you wish to detect the entities
and choose input document as one
document per file
then click on Advanced document input
and choose the document read mode as
service default
then choose the document read action as
text track detect document text
and giving it an output location where
the results of the entity Direction job
will be stored
choose the IIM role to access your S3
buckets
then click on create job
now look at the status of your job in
progress
in few minutes you will see the status
of your job completed
once the job is complete you can review
the results of the job in ES3 output
location that you specified
click this S3 output data location link
and click download button to download
the file
output folder and you will see Json
output file generated by Amazon
comprehend
and you will see the entities detected
and entity types and The Confidence Code
for each entities detected
all of the operations that we have
discussed so far can also be performed
using AWS CLI and AWS SDK such as moto3

hope this demo will be helpful to
understand the inference capabilities of
